verses.verse: I made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>; why then should I think <S%H995><s%> upon a maid <S%H1330><s%>?
For what portion <S%H2506><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> is there from above <S%H4605><s%>? and what inheritance <S%H5159><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> from on high <S%H4791><s%>?
Is not destruction <S%H343><s%> to the wicked <S%H5767><s%>? and a strange <S%H5235><s%> punishment to the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%>?
Doth not he see <S%H7200><s%> my ways <S%H1870><s%>, and count <S%H5608><s%> all my steps <S%H6806><s%>?
If I have walked <S%H1980><s%> with vanity <S%H7723><s%>, or if my foot <S%H7272><s%> hath hasted <S%H2363><s%> to deceit <S%H4820><s%>;
Let me be weighed <S%H8254><s%> in an even <S%H6664><s%> balance <S%H3976><s%>, that God <S%H433><s%> may know <S%H3045><s%> mine integrity <S%H8538><s%>.

If my step <S%H838><s%> hath turned out <S%H5186><s%> of the way <S%H1870><s%>, and mine heart <S%H3820><s%> walked <S%H1980><s%> after <S%H310><s%> mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and if any blot <S%H3971><s%> hath cleaved <S%H1692><s%> to mine hands <S%H3709><s%>;
Then let me sow <S%H2232><s%>, and let another <S%H312><s%> eat <S%H398><s%>; yea, let my offspring <S%H6631><s%> be rooted out <S%H8327><s%>.
If mine heart <S%H3820><s%> have been deceived <S%H6601><s%> by a woman <S%H802><s%>, or if I have laid wait <S%H693><s%> at my neighbour's <S%H7453><s%> door <S%H6607><s%>;
Then let my wife <S%H802><s%> grind <S%H2912><s%> unto another <S%H312><s%>, and let others <S%H312><s%> bow down <S%H3766><s%> upon her.
For this is an heinous crime <S%H2154><s%>; yea, it is an iniquity <S%H5771><s%> to be punished by the judges <S%H6414><s%>.
For it is a fire <S%H784><s%> that consumeth <S%H398><s%> to destruction <S%H11><s%>, and would root out <S%H8327><s%> all mine increase <S%H8393><s%>.
If I did despise <S%H3988><s%> the cause <S%H4941><s%> of my manservant <S%H5650><s%> or of my maidservant <S%H519><s%>, when they contended <S%H7379><s%> with me;
What then shall I do <S%H6213><s%> when God <S%H410><s%> riseth up <S%H6965><s%>? and when he visiteth <S%H6485><s%>, what shall I answer <S%H7725><s%> him?
Did not he that made <S%H6213><s%> me in the womb <S%H990><s%> make <S%H6213><s%> him? and did not one <S%H259><s%> fashion <S%H3559><s%> us in the womb <S%H7358><s%>?
If I have withheld <S%H4513><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%> from their desire <S%H2656><s%>, or have caused the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the widow <S%H490><s%> to fail <S%H3615><s%>;
Or have eaten <S%H398><s%> my morsel <S%H6595><s%> myself alone, and the fatherless <S%H3490><s%> hath not eaten <S%H398><s%> thereof;
(For from my youth <S%H5271><s%> he was brought up <S%H1431><s%> with me, as with a father <S%H1><s%>, and I have guided <S%H5148><s%> her from my mother's <S%H517><s%> womb <S%H990><s%>;)
If I have seen <S%H7200><s%> any perish <S%H6><s%> for want of clothing <S%H3830><s%>, or any poor <S%H34><s%> without covering <S%H3682><s%>;
If his loins <S%H2504><s%> have not blessed <S%H1288><s%> me, and if he were not warmed <S%H2552><s%> with the fleece <S%H1488><s%> of my sheep <S%H3532><s%>;
If I have lifted up <S%H5130><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%> against the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>, when I saw <S%H7200><s%> my help <S%H5833><s%> in the gate <S%H8179><s%>:
Then let mine arm <S%H3802><s%> fall <S%H5307><s%> from my shoulder blade <S%H7929><s%>, and mine arm <S%H248><s%> be broken <S%H7665><s%> from the bone <S%H7070><s%>.
For destruction <S%H343><s%> from God <S%H410><s%> was a terror <S%H6343><s%> to me, and by reason of his highness <S%H7613><s%> I could <S%H3201><s%> not endure.
If I have made <S%H7760><s%> gold <S%H2091><s%> my hope <S%H3689><s%>, or have said <S%H559><s%> to the fine gold <S%H3800><s%>, Thou art my confidence <S%H4009><s%>;
If I rejoiced <S%H8055><s%> because my wealth <S%H2428><s%> was great <S%H7227><s%>, and because mine hand <S%H3027><s%> had gotten <S%H4672><s%> much <S%H3524><s%>;
If I beheld <S%H7200><s%> the sun <S%H216><s%> when it shined <S%H1984><s%>, or the moon <S%H3394><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> in brightness <S%H3368><s%>;
And my heart <S%H3820><s%> hath been secretly <S%H5643><s%> enticed <S%H6601><s%>, or my mouth <S%H6310><s%> hath kissed <S%H5401><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%>:
This also were an iniquity <S%H5771><s%> to be punished by the judge <S%H6416><s%>: for I should have denied <S%H3584><s%> the God <S%H410><s%> that is above <S%H4605><s%>.
If I rejoiced <S%H8055><s%> at the destruction <S%H6365><s%> of him that hated <S%H8130><s%> me, or lifted up <S%H5782><s%> myself when evil <S%H7451><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> him:
Neither have I suffered <S%H5414><s%> my mouth <S%H2441><s%> to sin <S%H2398><s%> by wishing <S%H7592><s%> a curse <S%H423><s%> to his soul <S%H5315><s%>.
If the men <S%H4962><s%> of my tabernacle <S%H168><s%> said <S%H559><s%> not, Oh that we had <S%H5414><s%> of his flesh <S%H1320><s%>! we cannot be satisfied <S%H7646><s%>.
The stranger <S%H1616><s%> did not lodge <S%H3885><s%> in the street <S%H2351><s%>: but I opened <S%H6605><s%> my doors <S%H1817><s%> to the traveller <S%H734><s%>.
If I covered <S%H3680><s%> my transgressions <S%H6588><s%> as Adam <S%H121><s%>, by hiding <S%H2934><s%> mine iniquity <S%H5771><s%> in my bosom <S%H2243><s%>:

Did I fear <S%H6206><s%> a great <S%H7227><s%> multitude <S%H1995><s%>, or did the contempt <S%H937><s%> of families <S%H4940><s%> terrify <S%H2865><s%> me, that I kept silence <S%H1826><s%>, and went not out <S%H3318><s%> of the door <S%H6607><s%>?

Oh that <S%H5414><s%> one would hear <S%H8085><s%> me! behold, my desire <S%H8420><s%> is, that the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> would answer <S%H6030><s%> me, and that mine adversary <S%H376><s%> <S%H7379><s%> had written <S%H3789><s%> a book <S%H5612><s%>.
Surely I would take <S%H5375><s%> it upon my shoulder <S%H7926><s%>, and bind <S%H6029><s%> it as a crown <S%H5850><s%> to me.
I would declare <S%H5046><s%> unto him the number <S%H4557><s%> of my steps <S%H6806><s%>; as a prince <S%H5057><s%> would I go near <S%H7126><s%> unto him.
If my land <S%H127><s%> cry <S%H2199><s%> against me, or that the furrows <S%H8525><s%> likewise <S%H3162><s%> thereof complain <S%H1058><s%>;
If I have eaten <S%H398><s%> the fruits <S%H3581><s%> thereof without money <S%H3701><s%>, or have caused the owners <S%H1167><s%> thereof to lose <S%H5301><s%> their life <S%H5315><s%>:

Let thistles <S%H2336><s%> grow <S%H3318><s%> instead of wheat <S%H2406><s%>, and cockle <S%H890><s%> instead of barley <S%H8184><s%>. The words <S%H1697><s%> of Job <S%H347><s%> are ended <S%H8552><s%>.
